abstract: Rupert Murdoch starts tweeting, and deleting, over the weekend; a new ambassador for young people's literature; returning to the question of the police and Occupy Wall Street protests.
lead_paragraph: Twitter users could experience Rupert Murdoch unfiltered this New Year's weekend, as he joined the service and immediately began sharing his thoughts large and small. One post indicated support for Rick Santorum on the eve the Iowa caucuses, saying he was "Only candidate with genuine big vision for country." In the past, Brian Stelter writes on The Caucus blog, Mr. Santorum has criticized Fox News as part of his broader complaint that the news media has ignored his candidacy, saying, "You know, Bill O'Reilly has refused to put me on his program." On Monday night, Mr. O'Reilly acknowledged Mr. Santorum's recent rise in the polls and said, "We have invited Rick Santorum to appear on Wednesday."
